item.description:
@culturaltutor Seeing homes as an investment makes people pick more neutral colors. You don‚Äôt get what you like but what you think won‚Äôt offend potential future buyers.

Similar for cars but for preserving resell value rather than investment.

I am neutral on the subject (womp womp)

From @EconTalker‚Äôs excellent ‚ÄúHow Adam Smith can change your life‚Äù. Our emotions are antifragile! (makes sense, otherwise humanity would have grieved itself out of existence) I thought I heard every interview he had with @nntaleb but don‚Äôt remember mentioning it. #RWRI #RWRI17 https://t.co/WlsaIBQ4nt

item.description:
@nntaleb "Psychologists pro-science" chef's kiss

Janan Ganesh is the rare newspaper columnist who is able to think clearly and string coherent arguments across articles. Most can't manage consistency between two paragraphs.
item.source:markdown:
@nntaleb "Psychologists pro-science" *chef's kiss*
Janan Ganesh is the rare newspaper columnist who is able to think clearly and string coherent arguments across articles. Most can't manage consistency between two paragraphs.

item.description: @NoemiTitarenco @fortelabs Apple Notes has improved by orders of magnitude in the last 2-3 years. The only thing against it is that Apple hasn‚Äôt cared much for backward compatibility and exporting, and they‚Äôve abandoned even more popular software in the past. Are you worried about lock-in?
item.source:markdown: @NoemiTitarenco @fortelabs Apple Notes has improved by orders of magnitude in the last 2-3 years. The only thing against it is that Apple hasn‚Äôt cared much for backward compatibility and exporting, and they‚Äôve abandoned even more popular software in the past. Are you worried about lock-in?

item.description: @pauld198 @mikeharrisNY Wish it were only lit majors‚Ä¶ Science and med twitter are full of threads on how to make everything into a story. Grant workshops that teach you how to package your proposal into a streamlined easily digestible narrative aren't helping.
item.source:markdown: @pauld198 @mikeharrisNY Wish it were only lit majors‚Ä¶ Science and med twitter are full of threads on how to make everything into a story. Grant workshops that teach you how to package your proposal into a streamlined easily digestible narrative aren't helping.

item.description: @timtriche The trouble is that it works so well in so many domains that you can be fooled into thinking it is universal. That's why it should be a full year course. (btw for amateurs playing with fun bits of math that don't do well with arithmetic, Mathemathica is excellent </psa>)
item.source:markdown: @timtriche The trouble is that it works so well in so many domains that you can be fooled into thinking it is universal. That's why it should be a full year course. (btw for amateurs playing with fun bits of math that don't do well with arithmetic, Mathemathica is excellent </psa>)

item.description: @timtriche Yes! There should be a full semester-long course in probability. Brushing over dice rolls and the Gaussian distribution in a week or two does more harm than good.
item.source:markdown: @timtriche Yes! There should be a full semester-long course in probability. Brushing over dice rolls and the Gaussian distribution in a week or two does more harm than good.

item.description:
‚ÄúIf you go to the casino you got to play for years before you win eight times in a row. But if you have 8 billion people play in the casino, that will happen every day. This is how we can trade time for sample size‚Äù.

As simple as you can make it. Still won‚Äôt change people‚Äôs mind https://t.co/9H2KRS7lDo

item.description:
As good of a day as any to note that using sarcasm is intellectually lazy anywhere, but both lazy and dangerous on Twitter. @boztank says it well https://t.co/m1XmzO968u

My own contribution from last year is‚Ä¶ less cogent https://t.co/GrN0eZIf9h

item.description: @DrChrisHourigan Not an expert either. The last time I checked (board prep 5+ years ago) it was mainly for children. Assuming some evidence for adults has been generated since‚Ä¶? If any of your followers know, would be nice to learn.
item.source:markdown: @DrChrisHourigan Not an expert either. The last time I checked (board prep 5+ years ago) it was mainly for children. Assuming some evidence for adults has been generated since‚Ä¶? If any of your followers know, would be nice to learn.

item.description: @DrChrisHourigan Great sentence. But: "Half a century later, [proton beam] therapy has now become standard around the globe‚Ä¶" Is this true? Have protons replaced photons in IMRT?
item.source:markdown: @DrChrisHourigan Great sentence. But: "Half a century later, [proton beam] therapy has now become standard around the globe‚Ä¶" Is this true? Have protons replaced photons in IMRT?

item.description: @nntaleb It takes a special kind of idiot to intentionally misinterpret an add for the German version of VAERS as groundbreaking news. The upside is that it is yet another litmus test for reading comprehension and general intelligence (much better than IQ!)

item.description: Please, please, please do not cite narrative reviews for your (potentially contentious) claims, even if you are a public health agency. Especially if you are a public health agency. https://t.co/VFTUlDLeOK https://t.co/XyPT6vSMmg
item.source:markdown: Please, please, please do not cite narrative reviews for your (potentially contentious) claims, even if you are a public health agency. *Especially* if you are a public health agency. https://t.co/VFTUlDLeOK https://t.co/XyPT6vSMmg

item.description: Nassim Taleb is a tough act to follow, but this 90-minute primer on covid was A+. A tiny quibble (I have to, I‚Äôm sorry): A.F. discouraging mask use was more a misguided attempt to manage the shortage than an evidence-based rec. Backfired, obviously. https://t.co/AkQexrNwfl
